newsitem.title: INDIA: CRICKET-AZHARUDDIN RECALLED TO NATIONAL SQUAD.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-AZHARUDDIN RECALLED TO NATIONAL SQUAD.

text.p: Former captain Mohammad Azharuddin was recalled by India on Monday for their tour of Sri Lanka beginning later this month.
Azharuddin was dropped for the recent Independence Cup one-day tournament in India following a poor run of form on the tour of the West Indies.
Two newcomers have been included in the 14-man squad, paceman Debashish Mohanty and left-arm spinner Nilesh Kulkarni.
The selectors omitted left-hand batsman Vinod Kambli, wicketkeeper Nayan Mongia and all-rounder Sunil Joshi from the squad that played in the Independence Cup tournament.
Sachin Tendulkar and Anil Kumble were retained as captain and vice-captain.
Following the four-nation Asia Cup limited-overs tournament, which also includes Pakistan and Bangladesh, India will play two tests and three one-day internationals against Sri Lanka.

The Indian squad is: Sachin Tendulkar (captain), Anil Kumble, Navjot Sidhu, Rahul Dravid, Sourav Ganguly, Mohammad Azharuddin, Saba Karim, Ajay Jadeja, Debashish Mohanty, Nilesh Kulkarni, Venkatesh Prasad, Abey Kuruvilla, Noel David, Robin Singh.
